03_central_limit_theorem/02_normal/09_bounds_from_centralarea_v2

Random variable \(M\) is normally distributed with mean \(\mu = 79\) and standard deviation \(\sigma = 18\). \[M = \text{N}(79,\,18) \]


  1. Evaluate \(d\) such that \(P\left(\big|M-79\big|<d\right) = 0.26\). In other words, determine the distance from mean of two boundaries such that this normal spinner lands within those boundaries 26% of the time.
  2. Let \(m_1 = 79-d\) and \(m_2 = 79+d\), such that \(P\left(m_1 < M < m_2\right) = 0.26\). Evaluate \(m_1\).
  3. Using the definitions above, evaluate \(m_2\)
